quizInfo.Subject: Management Information Systems
quizInfo.Title: Witness that stars shatter before you. Survive or be destroyed. There is no other choice.

quizData.question: What term refers to a number, statement, etc. that represents specific data?
What is a collection of data?
What characteristic of information states that info must be up to date?
What characteristic of information requires the system to have relevant info in every module for users who need it?
What characteristic of information states that info must be correct or precise?
What characteristic of information states that info must only contain the minimum detail appropriate to the user?
What characteristic of information states that info and its format and presentation must be understandable?
What characteristic of information states that info must be complete based on the requirements?
What term refers to components that are interrelated and work together with a common goal to accept inputs and outputs?
What is the general term for a computer or other piece of technology and its dependencies?
What term encompasses all working parts required to run a technical process?
What defines the scope of activities in which viewing or accessing any module of a system is limited?
What term describes that every user has specific access on each module of a system?
What is the term for parts of a system that have different objectives and interactions based on requirements?
What term describes that all parts of a system use the given resources to meet the given objective?
What serves as the connection to display the output of one system to the input of another?
What term refers to people or organizations that give and receive data from the system?
What term describes effective feedback assuring users that the system can achieve its goals?
What term describes that every system always needs feedback to be able to do its job and process accurately based on the requirements?
What component of a system refers to the info the user adds to the system?
What component of a system refers to the efficiency of data processing?
What component of a system enables organizations to process big data?
What component of a system refers to the info the system displays as a result?
What component of a system refers to comments and suggestions to improve the processes of a system?
What component of a system refers to managing the operations in every process of the system?
What term refers to interrelated components that collect, output, and process data to support decision making?
What term refers to a system that may consist of hardware, software, people, procedures, and telecommunication?
What term involves factors such as organization structure, business procedure, culture, environment, and management decisions?
What type of information system is widely used?
What type of information system records data collected at the boundaries of organizations?
What type of information system records transactions inside an organization?
What type of information system includes a sequence of activities such as marketing, manufacturing, assembly, and packing?
What type of information system manages the relationship between a customer and an organization?
What type of information system is used by service representatives to talk to their customers via phone?
What type of information system is used to compete with other organizations?
What type of information system accesses massive data, usually larger databases called data warehouses?
What type of information system helps to find actions and answers to questions like "What If?"
What type of information system uses AI to preserve the knowledge of an expert and to solve problems?
What is another name for Systems Development Life Cycle?
What methodology follows well-defined phases methodically?
What methodology is used by large organizations to check requirement compliance and progress?
What is the oldest method of system development?
What methodology divides development into formal stages?
What methodology is used for large complex systems that require formal requirements analysis, predefined specifications, and tight control?
What methodology ensures that every stage has an activity and follows a sequential order?
What stage of the System Life Cycle involves steps to come up on the data?
What stage of the System Life Cycle requires data analysis, problem identification, info requirement, and objective determination?
What stage of the System Life Cycle includes Investigation, Technical feasibility, Economic feasibility, Operational feasibility, and Requirements definition?
What stage of the System Life Cycle determines how the system will fulfill the objectives based on requirements?
What stage of the System Life Cycle describes functions, components, construction, and testing?
What stage of the System Life Cycle communicates ideas about the data using convention symbols?
What diagram is suitable for describing any information system, even if it’s not computer-based?
What diagram has limitations and cannot describe a system completely?
What graphical standard is used for visualization, specifying, and documenting software?
What stage of the System Life Cycle translates system specifications into code?
What stage of the System Life Cycle is the most respected phase?
What stage of the System Life Cycle states that testing each module in every simulation isn’t enough?
What stage of the System Life Cycle emphasizes testing the entire system?
What stage of the System Life Cycle involves Unit Testing, System Testing, and Acceptance Testing?
What stage of the System Life Cycle is also known as delivery?
What stage of the System Life Cycle consists of conversion from the old to the new system and training?
What stage of the System Life Cycle begins when the system is installed?
In what stage of the System Life Cycle is the system reviewed by users and tech specialists to check if it meets the objectives and must be maintained?
In what stage of the System Life Cycle are errors corrected, requirements met, and efficiency improved?
In what stage of the System Life Cycle is the system in maintenance if changes, new requirements, or improvements are implemented?
Which approach in software development relies on individual staff skills and experience?
Which software development approach refers to small projects at which the staff is skilled?
What is the most common and earliest structured system used in software development?
Which software development approach involves the steps: System Analysis, System Design, Programming, Testing, Deployment, and Maintenance?
Which software development approach assumes that all requirements are known at the beginning of the project?
Which approach involves building a simple version of the software, presenting it to the client, receiving feedback, and making adjustments?
Which software development approach includes the steps: Requirements definition, Design, Prototype creation, Assessment, Prototype refinement, and System implementation?
Which model includes the best features from both the Waterfall and Prototyping models?
Which approach describes the process followed as the development takes place?
Which software development approach involves the steps: Project objectives, Risk assessment, Production, Planning, and Management?
Which approach focuses on fast software delivery by dividing a large project into a series of small subprojects?
Which software development model allows risk reduction and quicker adaptability by assigning each team to a small project?
In which software development approach is face-to-face communication preferred over written documents for better collaboration and quicker decision-making?
What system allows efficient collection and management of data?
What serves as an interface between data resources and application programs?
What transition is considered a costly long-term process when shifting from traditional filing?
What process must understand both managerial and organizational requirements and the technologies for managing data?
What is difficult for every organization and business?
What must be accurate and structured to provide exact information?
What realization led organizations to gain a competitive advantage using useful information?
What file organization type is used for processing the same information repeatedly?
What file organization type is used with magnetic disks?
What file access method stores records using a primary key?
What file access method generates an index value for each primary key and maps it with the record?
What file access method uses a primary key in combination with mathematical calculations to find the location of a record?
What ensures coordination of business aspects by gathering data from various resources?
What difficulty arises due to hardware and software diversity when integrating information?
What integrates manufacturing, production, finance, accounting, sales, marketing, and HR in a single system?
What system is exemplified by SAP, Peoplesoft, and Oracle?
What system uses databases, processes, and rules to provide up-to-the-minute financial data?
What system handles all financial accounting systems and emphasizes purchasing, HR management, and investment management?
What is a stable, formal social structure that takes resources and processes them to produce outputs?
What is more stable than informal groups in longevity and routines?
What refers to how work is organized, coordinated, and focused on producing a valuable product or services?
What can be liabilities if they’re based on inefficient ways that impede organization responsiveness and efficiency?
What crosses many different functional areas and require coordination across departments?
What deals with behavioral and technical issues surrounding the development, use, and impact of information systems used by managers and employees in a firm?
What is there a whole new world of doing using new technology for managing and organizing?
What change of high importance in MIS is transforming the traditional business world with a continuous stream of it?
What change of high importance in MIS has forever changed how premium video is distributed and created with the emergence of online video streaming services for downloading video?
What change of high importance in MIS changes how firms produce, design, and deliver their products and services?
What change of high importance in MIS reinvented itself, disrupting the traditional marketing and advertising?
What change of high importance in MIS has changed in the management of business firms?
What change of high importance in MIS states that new, fast-going 21st century firms put less emphasis on hierarchy and structure and more on employees?
IT became a vital and integral part of every business plan. (TR or FL)
Organizational structure of the IS function and distribution of employees are designed to meet the changing strategies of the business. (TR or FL)
Form of an IT organization depends on the managerial philosophy and strategies formulated during the strategic planning process. (TR or FL)
What refers to the determination of the basic long-term goals and adoption of courses of action and allocation of resources in achieving these goals?
choices: Use of Systems for Competitive Advantage

quizData.question: What involves leveraging technology in the value chain?
choices: Use of Systems for Competitive Advantage

quizData.question: Using IS to beat the competition and increase value of product is not easy. (TR or FL)
What requires changing the processes and methods that probably have been in the organization for a long time?
quizData.answer: Use of Systems for Competitive Advantage
choices: Use of Systems for Competitive Advantage

quizData.question: The responsibility for successfully developing and then using an integrated IS will usually fall on who?
What computing systems and platforms allow non-programmers who use computers to create apps and outputs?
What computing concept involves, enables, and integrates people with no background in programming into computing systems?
Which computing system allows end users to better control their computing environment without the aid of real programmers?
What is the most common hardware aspect of an End User Computing (EUC) solution?
What type of End User Computing covers the software aspect of desktop and laptop computers, either packaged or sold separately?
What type of End User Computing refers to mobile hardware platforms such as phones, tablets, and watches?
What type of End User Computing gives priority and connectivity regardless of platform, such as email, instant messaging, and cloud storage?
What type of End User Computing enhances mobility and connectivity through the development of cloud-based computing solutions?
What practice in End User Computing allows end users to develop their own information systems with IT support?
What End User Development activities include providing computing workstations, elevated data access, and internet connectivity?
What happens when poorly trained end users are incapable of correctly analyzing data or systems?
What issue arises when documentation is often inadequate or nonexistent, making maintenance difficult and expensive?
What term refers to erroneous manufactured hardware and bugs in software?
What risk occurs when an organization's data or actual software itself may be at risk of being manipulated or stolen?
What type of End User Computing tool consists of prewritten software packages marketed commercially?
What type of End User Computing tool supports standard business functions like payroll, ledgers, and scheduling?
What type of End User Computing tool is customizable via key parameters, such as MS Office?
What programming tool allows end users to develop their computing solutions and consolidate them into small systems?
What End User System Tool includes word processing and presentation software?
What End User System Tool consists of spreadsheets, statistical packages, and databases?
What End User System Tool includes emails and VoIP?
What End User System Tool includes E-notebooks, directories, and project management tools?
What End User System Tool includes teleconferencing and virtual workspaces?
What End User System Tool includes graphic software and computer-aided design?
What End User System Tool includes data mining?
What refers to the complete integration of basic office requirements for a department in an organization?
What includes requirements such as word processing, electronic data filing, diary management, and communications?
What organizes functions in a way that they don’t have to be done separately or use additional workforce?
What uses software, hardware, and networking to improve workflow and communication of office workers?
What supports the collection of business office activities to help management and workforce manage jobs?
What can evolve and become automated to increase flexibility and effectiveness?
What functionality facilitates e-communication via email and instant messaging?
What functionality manages audio-video communications via telephony or teleconferencing?
What functionality facilitates record management via databases or data servers?
What functionality automates business-specific processes to reduce or eliminate manpower requirements?
What provides EUC to enhance end-user (employees) efficiency?
What refers to operations performed by activating key sequences like copy and paste?
What refers to bundled apps that interact with system resources for various tasks like MS Office?
What provides specific capabilities other than those commonly offered and can be individual or bundled?
What software is designed for developing textual documents?
What is used for accounting and financial purposes, designed for maintaining, manipulating, and calculating data?
What provides organized e-storage to search for and display pieces of information?
What software allows users to layout text, graphics, and pictures on a page?
What software allows users to switch from one form of presentation to another for different users?
What software helps users identify tasks, track progress, and report information about a project?
What software is used to schedule events and includes additional functions like to-do lists and reminders?
What permits sending information to users through computers’ communication links?
What refers to an information system that provides fast and inexpensive communication channels using telephony, computing hardware, networks, and the internet?
What category of electronic communication systems is based on time and availability?
What type of electronic communication requires members to be available at the same time to communicate?
What type of electronic communication doesn’t require members to be available at the same time?
What component of ECS is mostly synchronous and encourages greater collaboration between the organization and its members?
What uses internet-based technologies to facilitate a broader coverage of members and eliminate the need for physical locations?
What type of electronic conferencing involves only two points between two members, similar to phone calls?
What type of electronic conferencing involves multiple points between multiple members?
What type of electronic conferencing uses a central network hub and allows simultaneous collaboration on various predefined locations?
What is a component of ECS that assists in the creation, organization, and facilitation of meetings?
What component of ECS can either be synchronous or asynchronous and uses multiple tools such as e-conferencing, scheduling, file sharing, and cross-portability features?
What component of ECS uses tools specifically designed for meetings?
What refers to an information system used to facilitate textual or non-textual discussions between members using an available electronic medium?
What is a broader type of digital conversation?
What type of electronic discussion requires a user to take action to access the discussion, such as logging into an online forum?
What type of electronic discussion doesn’t require anything from the user, as information is automatically disseminated?
What type of electronic discussion disseminates information with or without the obligation for the user to retrieve it manually?
What aspect of ECS facilitates the digital publishing of textual material and other readable information?
What aspect of ECS makes materials available for viewing using a device with an electronic screen, such as a computer?
What refers to a means of storing and publishing e-textual content such as DVDs and CDs?
What converts traditional media formats and publishes them as digital copies, such as PDFs and e-books?
What type of digital publishing relies on the internet to reach its target recipients, such as blogs and digital publication platforms?
What uses the internet to facilitate publishing with an emphasis on collaboration between recipients?
What is a paperless and environmentally friendly medium?
What benefit of electronic publishing refers to its portability and storage capabilities?
What benefit of electronic publishing allows digital distribution?
What is a potential risk of electronic publishing related to data privacy concerns?
What risk of electronic publishing allows digital content to be stolen and used without following traditional policies?
What risk of electronic publishing is caused by the perception that internet information should be free, making paid content models less appealing?
What involves sharing of information over a distance allowing businesses and organizations to have a broad, possibly global reach?
What includes telephony, fax, email, and the internet?
What can have different types depending on the information sender, the intended recipient, how data gets to the recipient, and how the information is distributed?
What is circulated within the business or organization?
What is defined as the information comes from the superiors cascaded down through departments?
What example is given: Memorandum?
What involves subordinates sending information up the hierarchy to their superiors?
What example is given: Budget approval documents?
What involves communication between co-workers and members of departments in the same level?
What example is given: Email between employees of the same department?
What involves information leaving the business or organization, mostly dealing with customer prospects, vendors, or partners?
What example is given: Business pitch?
What refers to employable methods business and organizations use to disseminate information?
What provides communication connectivity to its other aspects such as prospective clients, branches and departments to further streamline specific processes and tasks?
What means only 1 member of the network (the manager) is allowed to send or receive information?
What advantage of the wheel network is: It’s direct and efficient?
What disadvantage of the wheel network is: With a higher number of people being handled, the leader may not be responsive?
What involves communication in a set sequence?
What follows the organization’s hierarchy, such as the CEO’s message going down to departments?
What advantage of the chain network is: Follows the chain of command and apply quality control?
What disadvantage of the chain network is: May suffer from misinformation if the organization is large due to the length of communication the information must pass through?
What is defined as a 3-level hierarchy where there’s communication between superiors and subordinates with cross-communication at the operative level?
What advantage of the circle network is: Quick and open collaboration between superiors and subordinates?
What disadvantage of the circle network is: Same problems from the chain network applies?
What means all channels are open?
What is similar to a circle network except all members can communicate with all members?
What involves the highest participation and collaboration between members?

What is an organizational system in an enterprise that applies electronically-controlled technology and resources in its operational systems to facilitate more efficient execution of business activities like selling products and servers to customer service and support?
What involves the application of IT and IT professionals, as well as the internet, to traditional business processes?
What benefit of E-Businesses involves applying telecommunication and networking to reduce operational cost?
What benefit of E-Businesses involves machines automating processes that require manual labor otherwise?
What benefit of E-Businesses allows use of technologies such as email, saving costs in communication and transaction?
What benefit of E-Businesses improves customer service due to its reach, speed, and reliability?
What benefit of E-Businesses reaches more customers and services them in a short amount of time?
What benefit of E-Businesses allows businesses offering products to streamline delivery processes and digitize payment modes?
What benefit of E-Businesses allows broader reach to a target market?
What benefit of E-Businesses allows business and organizations to tailor its service and processes to suit a variety of clients?
What benefit of E-Businesses allows enterprises to either design a marketing strategy to center on particular locations to establish a stronger presence or reach out on an international level?
What possible application of E-Business solutions is defined as through websites, enterprises can conduct business with a variety of clients on a local, national, or global scale?
What possible application of E-Business solutions involves companies developing solutions to revolutionize an industry due to the number of possibilities of online commerce?
What possible application of E-Business solutions is defined as consumers want information about the products and services they plan on getting?
What possible application of E-Business solutions involves companies addressing this with reviews from websites and/or services that offer review services?
What service, called intermediation, introduces other customers and businesses as middlemen to help an enterprise flourish?
What possible application of E-Business solutions allows companies to opt to offer services from other enterprises such as credit card transaction processing / e-payment systems?
What possible application of E-Business solutions involves some application suites being bought by businesses and organizations to help them set an online presence?
What are the earliest computerized systems whose purpose is to record, process, validate, and store transactions in various functional areas of business for future retrieval and use?
What records company transactions and process data resulting from the occurrence of business transactions?
What type of transaction is done within the company and is usually related to the internal processes of any organization?
What example is given: Recruitment systems for human resources?
What type of transaction is external to any organization and related to external sources?
What example is given: Purchasing systems for supply chains; sales systems for product sellers?
What is the first step in transaction processing where transactional data must be first entered so it can be processed?
What involves input devices like mice in transaction processing?
What step in transaction processing requires the system to use the 2 steps in validation: error validation and error correction?
What step in transaction processing follows once accuracy and reliability of data are validated, where the data is ready to be processed?
What processing mode is described as almost instantaneous processing due to internet connectivity?
What processing mode involves transactions being accumulated over time and processed?
What step in transaction processing is where processed data must be properly stored for future use?
What step in transaction processing is where the output can be communicated to decision makers in the form of documents/reports (physical) and forms (digital)?
What step in transaction processing allows users to process data and information that may otherwise be unavailable, like previously stored data, by providing proper parameters for retrieval?
What is the information system that can record, process, and report all routine and repetitive activities of an organization, where the process may occur across departments?
What advantage of operational information systems is described as operational costs are reduced due to streamlined processes especially those who needs manual labor to do?
What advantage of operational information systems is described as automated routine processes use the system’s processing power to finish tasks quickly?
What advantage of operational information systems is described as human error is reduced and the system is capable of accomplishing tasks using a fool-proof algorithm?
What advantage of operational information systems is described as systems can also streamline customer service processes to ensure efficient delivery?

What advantage of operational information systems is described as OIS can store and generate data for reports, documents, etc. that can be used by executives for decisions concerning the future of the enterprise?

What system supports management decision making by providing reports such as regular summary, exception reports, and ad-hoc reports, and helps managers control their areas of responsibility as well as allocate their resources and focus on management?

At the managerial level, which system allows various apps to handle particular organizational functions and supports diverse tactical decisions such as selecting the appropriate staff and purchasing/leasing of equipment?

Which system permits managers to track and compare actual revenues and expenses, compares current budget amounts to those of prior fiscal periods, and assesses how they use their resources to achieve their goals?
Which system produces cash flow reports that show estimated incoming and outcoming cash amounts for specific timeframes and allows managers to manage cash on hand to ensure continued operations?

Which system focuses on producing information for the acquisition/disposal of assets using evaluation tools and the system’s data to compare information from current and previous timeframes for evaluating asset acquisition or disposal?
Which system produces reports that allow a manager to oversee an organization’s investments in stocks, bonds, or other securities as a separate but important aspect of cash management?

What system works in tandem with operational information systems for marketing and finance through various means such as processing of operational data, and allows tactical decision making by the marketing department such as the implementation of marketing plans in order to reach sales and profit margins set by higher management?

What system allows managers to assess the productivity of a salesforce, the profitability of certain locations, and the success of products further categorized by sales persons, locations, and target demographic, and keeps track of activities, sales, orders, and customer activities which allows a manager to identify points of interest in terms of location, performance, and demographics?

What system governs advertising and promotional tactics in order to achieve sales goals set by upper management, and requires that managers decide which advertising media and promotional devices to use to reach the selected market segments, when to use these media and devices, and what overall mix of promotional activities to deploy to achieve sales goals?

What system provides information to managers that allows them to set prices for products and services, and allows managers to employ marketing strategies to determine sales volumes and profitability margins based on market volatility?

What system provides information on costs for using various distribution channels—including details such as timeframes for deliveries, time lags caused by the use of certain channels, reliability ratings based on delivery efficiency, and the market segment situation—and is used in tandem with demand and inventory of items so that the manager can anticipate shortages or oversupply of items?
What system works in tandem with operational information systems for marketing and finance through various means such as processing of operational data?
What system allows tactical decision making by the marketing department such as the implementation of marketing plans in order to reach sales and profit margins set by higher management?
What system creates different types of sales forecasts, from industry sales, product/services sales, to forecast market segments?

What system is usually based on more than just historical data, as it’s also based on assumptions concerning possible factors such as activities of other enterprises, government actions and policies, economic trends and demands, and other functions like weather?
What system handles marketing research whether for research departments, for large organizations, or via consultants for smaller enterprises?

What system involves conducting trend analysis of industry-wide market sales analysis of target demographics and customer satisfaction for products/services, and market shares estimated for the products/services offered?
What system makes information about consumer preferences obtained from marketing research systems and from customer inquiries available?
What system's output information is used to develop new products with specifications that meet the criteria from the output information of the system?

What type of information system can provide support for production decisions like designing and layouting of production facilities, as well as the selection for facility technologies, policies, and personnel?
What type of information system involves decisions that require commitment of large amounts of capital and resources over a long period of time?
From which system is information considered important for production decisions?
What system relies on a variety of internal and external sources of information?
Which system requires information that is mostly external, objective, and quantitative in nature such as manpower/labor availability and cost?
Which system requires information including delivery systems for both raw and finished materials?
Which system requires information such as the availability of suitable locations?
Which system requires information such as land acquisition and cost?
Which system requires information such as distance to raw materials?
Which system requires information such as power costs?
Which system requires information such as the rate of property and income taxation?
What system allows top managers to make better or more informed decisions on which production technologies should be used for a product or service?
What system can identify new technology and assess them for their strategic advantages, which can help top management in other aspects than production?
What system may use underlying technology like databases, library resources, government databases, industry groups, private resource groups, and consulting organizations?
What system handles process positioning and vertical integration, which are processes that are to be performed for any given product/service?

What system includes information on processes such as production from raw materials, assembly, or outsourced prefabrication and labor that allows top management to create decisions based on costs, production duration, and demand?
What system processes information for decisions concerning proposed facilities?
What system uses information that includes facility design and layout?
What system uses information that includes proposed technologies?
What system uses information that includes personnel?
What system uses information that includes expected completion dates?
What system uses information that includes transportation?
What system uses information that includes costs of materials for construction?
What system uses information that includes maintenance?
From which system can information be procured from site planning, technology assessment, and process positioning?
What system is described as "A number of human resource management information systems had been developed to assist managers in human resources."?
quizData.answer: Tactical and Strategic Human Resource Information System
choices: Tactical and Strategic Human Resource Information System

quizData.question: What system is described as "HRIS and its apps contain personal information of employees, as well as the organization’s resource in labor and manpower."?
quizData.answer: Tactical and Strategic Human Resource Information System
choices: Tactical and Strategic Human Resource Information System

quizData.question: What system is emphasized when stating "Securing this information from unauthorized access is important to all organizations involved and unauthorized use is illegal and can subject organizations to serious legal liability."?
quizData.answer: Tactical and Strategic Human Resource Information System
choices: Tactical and Strategic Human Resource Information System

quizData.question: What system "supports HR managers in handling aspects of the acquisition, allocation, and maintenance of an organization’s workforce."?
choices: Tactical and Strategic Human Resource Information System

quizData.question: What system "includes the creation of jobs for a specific purpose, employee acquisition, training and capacity building, and budget allocations."?
choices: Tactical and Strategic Human Resource Information System

quizData.question: What system "creates jobs/positions required by an organization."?
What system "involves writing job descriptions."? (TR or FL)
What system "involves designation of purposes, tasks, duties, and responsibilities for a job/position."?
What system "involves specifying the conditions and performance standards."?
What system "involves processing of information from guidelines and external data sources (e.g., labor unions, etc.)"?
What system "handles functions that provide a pool of qualified applicants that may fill vacant positions identified by position control systems and/or job analysis and design systems."?
What system "ensures that the recruitment processes of an organization are compliant with government laws and contract regulations to guarantee affirmative action and equal employment opportunity."?
choices: Tactical and Strategic Human Resource Information System

quizData.question: What system "allows HR managers to support the creation of compensation and benefit plans for employees."?
What system "using data such as budget allocations and job descriptions, provides a variety of tactical information for employee compensation and benefits."?
What system "handles decisions for employee development, usually via capacity building."?

What system "is facilitated by finding potential employees that meet certain criteria and creating training and development plans that will allow interested and qualified individuals to benefit from these plans."?
What system "ensures that replacements for key positions in the organization are available at all times to ensure that they don’t become vacant."?
choices: Tactical and Strategic Human Resource Information System

quizData.question: What manages the organization’s workforce as a whole?
What allows an HR manager to formulate workforce plans and labor negotiations to ensure that the enterprise has the appropriate conditions for the appropriate personnel?
What facilitates strategic long-term workforce planning and management using relevant data such as those from other information systems?

What uses forecasted workforce estimates (which includes workforce supply and demand, required skills and specializations, quality, and pricing) to create workforce plans that can achieve organizational objectives?
What gathers data from other HR information systems and from financial accounting systems and external sources in order to help create negotiating terms between the organization and labor unions?
What generates ad-hoc reports that allow the organization to see their and a labor union’s positions from industrial and economic standpoints?
What system helps executives make better decisions using historical and current data derived from internal information systems and external sources?
What system is comprised of smaller computer-based systems and subsystems with the use of communication technology and collation and organization of data and documents?
What system uses large amounts of data with analytical models and tools that becomes a reliable source of information to use in any decision-making processes?
Which DSS Framework element includes 5 generic categories that can be proposed?
Which DSS Framework element includes internal and external stakeholders such as employees, managers, consumers, and investors?
Which DSS Framework element includes specific or generalized objectives and is usually based on the system's application?
What DSS Framework element includes deployment on mainframe, client/server, LAN, or web-based architecture?
Which DSS Component refers to ways a user interacts with the system such as menu buttons to access system resources?
Which DSS Component holds all digitized data for system tasks?
Which DSS Component includes technological components used to accomplish the system’s scopes and tasks?
Which DSS Component includes how the system hardware is organized and how software and data are distributed?
What type of DSS takes large amount of data from other information systems like TPS?
What type of DSS doesn’t allow specific theories/models but can free-flow the data when needed?
File management systems and Executive Information Systems (EIS) are possible tools of what type of DSS?
What type of DSS emphasizes access to and manipulation of data models to help decision-making for possible and probable situations?
What type of DSS allows complex analysis of data and may be classified as a hybrid system due to data modelling, retrieval, and summarization?
What type of DSS is not data intensive?
What type of DSS focuses on knowledge as its primary framework factor?
What type of DSS can suggest or recommend actions?
What type of DSS is also known as Knowledge Management Systems?
What type of DSS is capable of helping managers work on unstructured digital documents and web pages?
What type of DSS provides retrieval and analysis of documents and other types of media like web pages, images, audio, and video?
What type of DSS handles organizational files like policies, product specifications, and corporate historical documents?
What type of DSS was previously known as Group Decision Support System (GDSS) or groupware?
What type of DSS includes communication, collaboration, and decision support technologies that don’t fit other DSS types?
What type of DSS is considered a hybrid system emphasizing both the use of communication and decision models?
What type of DSS allows the system to solve problems of decision-makers that work together as a group?
What type of DSS puts external (clients, customers) and internal (departments, employees) as their primary key factor?
What type of DSS is a relatively new type made possible by emerging technologies and the internet?
What type of DSS is designed to support more specific functions for specific types of industries or businesses?
What type of DSS is meant to solve problems involving broad, routine, or recurring decision tasks?
What type of system helps organizational managers and executives reach a consensus during events that require their collective opinion and proposals?
Which reason for using GDSS focuses on reducing pressures of conformity that results in group think?
Which reason for using GDSS includes streamlining coordination, representation, and planning of collaboration meetings?
Which reason for using GDSS helps optimize group dynamics by allotting appropriate responsibilities to each collaborator?
Which reason for using GDSS reduces the probability of the group making decisions of poor quality or high risk?
choices: Maximization of Group Effectiveness and Efficiency

quizData.question: Which reason for using GDSS provides access to rules that will aid in aiming at decisions?

quizData.question: Which GDSS element addresses agendas, topics, and end-goal of the discussion?
Which GDSS element ensures ideas and communications are free-flowing without interruptions or hindrances?
Which GDSS element provides equal opportunity for collaborators by eliminating office politics?
Which GDSS element takes care of logging information from the collaboration, such as meeting minutes and voting?
Which HDSS characteristic refers to equipment, computers, devices, etc.?
Which HDSS characteristic involves not just collaborators, but also facilitators, meeting planners, hardware operators, and staff?
Which HDSS characteristic is described as programs?
Which GDSS tool allows questioning, data-gathering and investigation for planning and collaboration?
Which GDSS tool facilitates the creation of proposals, ideas, and solutions that help in making decisions?
Which GDSS tool may eliminate office politics by making submitted proposals and votes anonymous?
Which GDSS tool determines the impact of the group’s decision?
Which GDSS tool may have the capability to weigh each collaborator’s vote on a decision before finalizing it?
Which GDSS tool allows the system to reduce a particular problem into distinct interpretations?
Which GDSS tool uses interpretations to help decision-makers make proper decisions?
Which DSS limitation states that it requires different types of typed, graphical, or spreadsheet input?
Which DSS limitation notes that the capabilities of GDSS become liabilities when multiple discussions about a decision take place?
Which DSS limitation explains that maintenance cost for a high-end facility may offset its cost-saving features?
Which DSS limitation indicates that a facilitator may be needed to help users and control the system?
What system is tailored for executive use?
What system was created to supply necessary tools for high-level decision-making?
What system facilitates predictions, summarizes information, and provides further acquisition of data?
What system uses mostly external data for executive decisions?
What system must be flexible and easy to manipulate to accommodate different problems and situations?
What role of ESS allows sifting through vast volumes of information to avoid irrelevant data?
What ESS role allows executives to avoid being overwhelmed by information?
What role of ESS links data from various sources to provide useful information for executives?
What role of ESS may incorporate internet connectivity to add more system flexibility?
What role of ESS supports interpersonal, informational, and decisional roles of executives?
What benefit of ESS facilitates timely data delivery through filtering, tracking, and processing?
What benefit of ESS helps senior managers produce relevant information for quick decisions?
What benefit of ESS allows executives to use the system without in-depth computer experience?
What benefit of ESS helps executives easily navigate the system?
What benefit of ESS allows integration with other systems due to fewer layers of management?
What disadvantage of ESS assumes executives know how to operate computers?
What disadvantage of ESS may delay results due to volume of data being processed?
What disadvantage of ESS is caused by insufficient summarized information from specific data?
What disadvantage of ESS makes it hard to justify decisions due to summarizing of data?
What disadvantage of ESS stems from inaccurate or incorrect data due to external sources?
